content: I also thought this was an interesting challenge, and actually somewhat related to real-world code-breaking. But, as a C++ programmer, I found it just a little too difficult. It shouldn't have been, but it was. If I ask myself why, it's because of searching for the indexes of characters in the alphabet. It could use a default A-Z and _ and it would still be challenging enough to be interesting. Believe it or not, I didn't manage to code it in 15 minutes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a simple and fun little puzzle. The matching of an existing word in the encoded text to find the shift number is an easy to solve but interesting twist.
I like the idea of really decoding a message by searching for an expected word. But also doing a scrambled alphabet seems unrelated and annoying.
There was a small bug in the last test case that I fixed.  Thank you @LazyMammal for finding it

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Straight forward puzzle for Clash of Code.  Good test case coverage.

Puzzle seems interesting. Just some minor nitpicks. 

1. "If the shift reaches the end of the letters then it wraps around."
- Maybe a bit more explanation would help here. letters vs ALPHABET, etc.
2. "The task is to decode a secret messages".
- Has an extra "s" or an extra "a" xD

Everything else seems good. :) [Upvoted!]
There are a bunch of Caesar cipher clashes already.  I quickly counted six just by opening ones with Caesar or cipher in the title, there are probably more.
The question has been simplified such that now there is just one guaranteed word that will be found in the secret message.
If you are going to downvote, please add a suggestion to help improve the contribution
Interesting one I like the concept.

Agree I don't like puzzles been voted down without comments about why. That doesn't help, specially for new people sending their firsts puzzles, it's good to have feedback so we know what to improve on.
CodinGame shouldn't allow downvotes and or upvotes without leaving related feedback.
Thanks for the reply Westicles.  I"ll use the search tool in the future.  For CoC I thought similar problems was okay.  Is that not the case?
Thanks for the feedback.  I'll correct those points.
Thanks!

I received feedback offline that this was too easy and too much like the dozens of other ROT13 puzzles.  The pad (scrambled alphabet) and the search are flairs to make it significantly different.  I did give some thought to hard coding the alphabet, but my code looked nearly identical, so I settled on this dynamic version.  Were you able to complete it?
Thanks
Thanks AndreMarasca.  The one line of hidden text has been moved to its own paragraph to highlight it.  Thanks for the feedback and approval

Thanks for the insight.  This was a tricky contribution because of the reuse of caesar cypher that is overused.  In an effort to make it more interesting a couple indirection had to be added.  I do appreciate that this could be difficult to complete in 15 min

Sure, it isn't a reason to reject, just maybe an explanation why a nice puzzle isn't getting a better response.  Kind of like the two ROT13 submissions in the last two days, I bet the regulars see these same ones over and over.
Good point.  I did notice that my other contribution that was probably more original got more upvotes.  Thanks again
I didn't mean you ;), I meant the 5 downvotes others have made without comment
